Package moulton.scalable.clickables

Class Clickable

java.lang.Object
moulton.scalable.utils.MenuComponent
moulton.scalable.clickables.Clickable
All Implemented Interfaces:
TouchResponsiveComponent
Direct Known Subclasses:
RadioButton, ScrollBar, TextBox
public abstract class Clickable
extends MenuComponent
implements TouchResponsiveComponent
Ancestor class for components that are clickable. These include buttons and text boxes. All subclasses should define clickBoundary when convenient to (usually during rendering) or else it won't be clickable. This can be done with defineClickBoundary(int[][]).

Components default to being deselected upon mouse release. However, this can be overridden by setting isDeselectedOnRelease() to false.

Author:
Matthew Moulton

  • Field Details

    • id

      protected java.lang.String id
      A unique string designed to identify this component when an event occurs.
      See Also:
      getId()

    • clicked

      protected boolean clicked
      Whether or not this component is selected by the press of the mouse currently.
      See Also:
      setClicked(boolean, int, int), isClicked(), clickableAt(int, int)

    • enabled

      protected boolean enabled
      Whether or not the component can be clicked and used.
      See Also:
      isEnabled(), setEnabled(boolean)

    • touched

      protected boolean touched
      Whether the clickable is currently touched by the mouse.
      See Also:
      isTouched(), setTouched(boolean), isTouchedAt(int, int)

    • outline

      protected boolean outline
      Whether or not this component should render a black outline on the border of the component.
      See Also:
      setOutline(boolean), getOutline()

    • formChain

      protected Clickable formChain
      The clickable specified here is the next clickable to be selected in the context of a form. A complete chain can be formed when multiple clickables are linked together in this way. When the user has a component in the chain selected and presses tab, selection goes to the next component.
      See Also:
      getFormChain(), setFormChain(Clickable)

    • touchAction

      protected EventAction touchAction
      The action that should be executed when the the component is first touched or loses touch. This action is called by MenuManager.mouseMoved(int, int).
      See Also:
      getTouchAction(), setTouchAction(EventAction)

    • clickAction

      protected EventAction clickAction
      The action that should be executed when the component is successfully clicked. This action is called by MenuManager.mouseReleased(int, int). If the EventAction returns true, the click event is not considered consumed.
      See Also:
      getClickAction(), setClickAction(EventAction)

    • lostFocusAction

      protected EventAction lostFocusAction
      The action that should be executed when the component loses focus. This action is called by MenuManager.componentLostFocus(Clickable). If the EventAction returns true, the lost focus event is not considered consumed.
      See Also:
      getLostFocusAction(), setLostFocusAction(EventAction)

    • clickBoundary

      protected int[][] clickBoundary
      A two-dimensional array holding the pixel x and y points for the polygon that represents this component's clickable area. clickBoundary[0] should hold x points and clickBoundary[1] should hold y points. The number of x and y points should be equal. Used to determine whether this component is clickable in clickableAt(int, int).
      See Also:
      defineClickBoundary(int[][])

  • Constructor Details

    • Clickable

      public Clickable​(java.lang.String id, Panel parent, java.lang.String x, java.lang.String y)
      This is for use of creating a clickable that will reside on the panel in a free-floating manner.
      Parameters:
      id - a unique string designed to identify this component when an event occurs
      parent - the parent panel for this component. Components on a menu at base-level have a parent panel of MenuManager.menu.
      x - the string equation dictating where on the parent panel this component should go. Often formatted as "centerx - width/#".
      y - the string equation dictating where on the parent panel this component should go. Often formatted as "centery - height/#".
      See Also:
      MenuComponent.solveString(String, int, int)

    • Clickable

      public Clickable​(java.lang.String id, Panel parent, int x, int y)
      This is for use of creating a clickable that will reside on the panel in a grid
      Parameters:
      id - a unique string designed to identify this component when an event occurs.
      parent - the parent panel for this component. Components on a menu at base-level have a parent panel of MenuManager.menu.
      x - the x coordinate of this clickable in its parent's grid
      y - the y coordinate of this clickable in its parent's grid

  • Method Details

    • isClicked

      public boolean isClicked()
      Returns whether or not the component is selected by the press of the mouse.
      Returns:
      clicked

    • clickableAt

      public boolean clickableAt​(int x, int y)
      Determines whether the component would be clicked by using the x and y values of the click and the boundary values as defined in clickBoundary. This will always return false if the component is not editable.
      Parameters:
      x - the x value of the mouse when clicked
      y - the y value of the mouse when clicked
      Returns:
      whether the component was decided to be clicked based on the params

    • defineClickBoundary

      public void defineClickBoundary​(int[][] clickBoundary)
      Defines the clickBoundary from the given. Defining the click boundary can easily be done during rendering since the component needs to be rendered before it can be clicked.
      Parameters:
      clickBoundary - the boundary of this component where each index is a vertex array containing x and y

    • getClickBoundary

      public int[][] getClickBoundary()
      Returns:
      clickBoundary

    • setClicked

      public void setClicked​(boolean clicked, int mouseX, int mouseY)
      Sets whether or not the component is currently selected by the press of a mouse. Different clickables handle this differently. Clickables like buttons are only clicked while the mouse button is held down. On the other hand, clickables like text boxes stay clicked even when the mouse button is released, instead changing to unclicked when the user deselects the text box. Sometimes clickable components need the exact mouse coordinates when this change occurs, thus they are provided even though they are not used in this method.
      Parameters:
      clicked - clicked
      mouseX - the x coordinate of the mouse when this change occurs
      mouseY - the y coordinate of the mouse when this change occurs
      See Also:
      isDeselectedOnRelease()

    • getId

      public java.lang.String getId()
      Returns the id of this component. The id is a unique string designed to identify this component when an event occurs.
      Returns:
      id

    • toString

      public java.lang.String toString()
      Overrides:
      toString in class java.lang.Object

    • isDeselectedOnRelease

      public boolean isDeselectedOnRelease()
      Returns whether or not the component should lose focus once the mouse lets go. Defaults to true.

      Some classes, like text boxes, need to retain focus so the user can enter secondary input. These classes need to override this method.

      Returns:
      whether the component should lose focus on mouse release

    • isTouchedAt

      public boolean isTouchedAt​(int x, int y)
      Whether a component is touched at (x,y) or clicked at that location is the same.
      Specified by:
      isTouchedAt in interface TouchResponsiveComponent
      Parameters:
      x - the x-coordinate of the point in question
      y - the y-coordinate of the point in question
      Returns:
      Whether the point touches the component
      See Also:
      clickableAt(int, int)

    • setTouched

      public void setTouched​(boolean touched)
      Description copied from interface: TouchResponsiveComponent
      When the MenuManager is processing mouse movement, the results of TouchResponsiveComponent.isTouchedAt(int, int) for the coordinates of the mouse will be passed through this method to update whether this component is touched. Therefore, this method is responsible for informing the component whether it is touched, whatever effect that may have.
      Specified by:
      setTouched in interface TouchResponsiveComponent
      Parameters:
      touched - whether the component is touched by the mouse: touched.

    • isTouched

      public boolean isTouched()
      Description copied from interface: TouchResponsiveComponent
      Whether this component thinks that it is touched.
      Specified by:
      isTouched in interface TouchResponsiveComponent
      Returns:
      the touched condition as of last update: touched.

    • getTouchedCursorType

      public int getTouchedCursorType()
      Returns the cursor type to draw. Defaults to Cursor.HAND_CURSOR.

      If a clickable subclass needs to have a different cursor type (like TEXT_CURSOR for text boxes), then this method should be overridden. If a subclass should not change which cursor type is used, Cursor.DEFAULT_CURSOR should be returned here.

      Specified by:
      getTouchedCursorType in interface TouchResponsiveComponent
      Returns:
      the cursor type constant, to be used by Container.setCursor(int)

      Parameters:
